page.title: 19Transport in St.Helens
page.content: The main form of transport in St.Helens is the bus.In 1985 a new bus station has opened.Most of the buses are single-decker ones,the driver collects the fares as you get on.They travel to all parts of the town at least twice an hour.We can visit others towns by bus.At least once an hour to Liverpool,Manchester,Wigan and Warrington. Another way of going to these places is by train,although to travel further afield we have to change trains at the main line stations. The town is surrounded by motorways. It takes half an hour to enter the motorway system and so most of industry use lorries to transport their goods.
